author: Staff Reporter
text:
Superintendent of Police S. Maheswaran (right) inspecting the karate training for police personnel in Namakkal on Saturday.

To keep them fit and enable protective measures while handling accused, karate training was imparted to the police personnel at the Armed Reserve Grounds here on Saturday.

Karate master Jackiechan and his assistants imparted training to the personnel in the presence of Superintendent of Police S. Maheswaran, Inspector of Armed Reserve A. Sitrarasu and other senior personnel.

The police said that getting trained in martial arts would keep them fit and also play a major role in handling the accused persons. Instead of possessing arms, their karate skills would prevent the accused from escaping while transporting them.
title: Karate training for police personnel
